meanings.definition: Daleths (noun): plural form of daleth, a letter of the Hebrew alphabet
meanings.sent1: In the Hebrew alphabet, daleths are important letters used for writing.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to identify the daleths in the text.
meanings.sent3: The daleths decided to have a race to see who could reach the end of the alphabet first.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts flowed like a river, each one a daleth in the story of her life.
meanings.sent5: The daleths danced across the page, forming words of ancient wisdom.

meanings.definition: Daleths (verb): third person singular present of daleth, to deal or trade
meanings.sent1: He daleths with honesty and integrity in all his business transactions.
meanings.sent2: She daleths goods with merchants from distant lands.
meanings.sent3: The cat daleths with the mouse, trying to negotiate a fair trade of cheese for freedom.
meanings.sent4: Time daleths with us, exchanging moments of joy for memories.
meanings.sent5: The sun daleths with the moon, trading places in the sky each day.

meanings.definition: Daleths (adjective): relating to or characteristic of daleths
meanings.sent1: The daleths symbols were beautifully engraved on the ancient tablet.
meanings.sent2: She wore a necklace adorned with daleths patterns and designs.
meanings.sent3: The daleths garden was filled with colorful flowers and fragrant herbs.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a maze of daleths thoughts, intricate and interconnected.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured the essence of daleths beauty, reflecting harmony and balance.
